snippet: Target has been trying to stop Amazon shoppers from checking products at Target stores and then buying them from Amazon.
abstract: Target, signaling its growing irritation with its rival Amazon, says it will stop selling Amazon Kindle e-readers; it has been trying to stop Amazon shoppers from checking products at Target stores and then buying them online from Amazon.

headline.main: Target, Unhappy With Being an Amazon Showroom, Will Stop Selling Kindles
headline.print_headline: Target, Unhappy With Being an Amazon Showroom, Will Stop Selling Kindles

byline.original: By STEPHANIE CLIFFORD and JULIE BOSMAN

snippet: The relationship between people and their homes is the subject of an exhibition at the National Building Museum in Washington.
abstract: Exhibit of artifacts and photos that explore the relationship between people and their homes opens at the National Building Museum in Washington.

snippet: People generally talk less on the phone and send fewer text messages now because there are so many ways to communicate over an Internet connection. Though this may seem obvious to anyone who owns a smartphone, a new study confirms the trend.
abstract: People generally talk less on the phone and send fewer text messages now because there are so many ways to communicate over an Internet connection. Though this may seem obvious to anyone who owns a smartphone, a new study confirms the trend.

headline.main: The State of Mobile: Less Talking, Fewer Texts, More Data

snippet: Airport guide apps can connect you with decent food, and may help you avoid overpaying for ground transportation.
abstract: Bob Tedeschi App Smart column highlights airport guide apps; notes they can connect the user with decent food, and may help one avoid overpaying for ground transportation.

headline.main: After the Plane Gets You to the Airport, an App Comes in Handy
headline.print_headline: After Your Airplane Lands, an App Comes In Handy

snippet: Do recent human rights cases and the standoff in the South China Sea point to a larger conflict on the horizon?
abstract: Do recent human rights cases and the standoff in the South China Sea point to a larger conflict on the horizon?

headline.main: Are We Headed for a Cold War With China?

snippet: The best of the season’s board books, featuring dinosaurs, bees, trains and more.
Shares rose after data on the manufacturing sector offered evidence of a faster economic recovery.
abstract: Shares rise after data on the manufacturing sector offers evidence of a faster economic recovery than expected, easing anxiety about a slowdown.

headline.main: Blue Chips Lead the Way As Major Indexes Close Higher
headline.print_headline: Blue Chips Lead the Way As Major Indexes Close Higher

snippet: The BlackBerry 10 is critical to the revival of Research in Motion, but early models given to app developers were missing features, like the ability to make calls.
abstract: Research in Motion unveils prototypes of the new BlackBerry 10 smartphone and has staked its future on hardware and software innovations; demonstrations raise concerns, however, as early models given to app developers are missing important features, like the ability to make calls.

headline.main: BlackBerry 10 Prototype Is Given to Developers
headline.print_headline: BlackBerry 10 Prototype Is Given to Developers

snippet: Readers react to an article about how Apple keeps its taxes low while profits soar.

headline.main: What Apple Pays in Taxes, and Doesn't

snippet: To silence her stubborn hiccups during the summer of 2010, Mallory Kievman tried swallowing saltwater, making herself gag, eating a spoonful of sugar, sipping pickle juice and drinking a glass of water upside-down. Nearly two years and 100 attempt...
abstract: You're the Boss blog notes that 13-year-old Mallory Kievman invented hiccup-stopping lollipops called Hiccupops; she is preparing to lead a team of MBA students from the University of Connecticut to get a start-up running. Photo (M)t

headline.main: Inventor, Age 13, Hires Marketers For a Cure for Hiccups
